xhwicap_clb_lut.h File Reference

Detailed Description

This header file contains bit information about the CLB LUT resource. This header file can be used with the XHwIcap_GetClbBits() and XHwIcap_SetClbBits() functions.

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:

 Ver   Who  Date     Changes
 ----- ---- -------- -------------------------------------------------------
 1.00a bjb  11/14/03 First release
 1.01a bjb  04/10/06 V4 Support
 2.00a ecm  10/20/07 V5 Support
 4.00a hvm  11/13/09 V6 Support


Defines

#define XHI_CLB_LUT_F   0
#define XHI_CLB_LUT_G   1

Variables

const XHwIcap_ClbLut XHI_CLB_LUT

Define Documentation

#define XHI_CLB_LUT_F   0
 

Index into SLICE and MODE for F LUT.

#define XHI_CLB_LUT_G   1
 

Index into SLICE and MODE for G LUT.

Variable Documentation

const XHwIcap_ClbLut XHI_CLB_LUT
 

This structure defines the Look Up Tables, or LUTs. in the Virtex4 CLB. Note that there are 8 16-bit LUTs, the F and G LUTs in Slice 0, 1, 2 and 3. These LUTs can take any arbitrary bit pattern.

Note, that DUAL_PORT mode cannot be configured here. Thats because it is essentially always in effect. But, it can only be used in the top two slices (2 and 3) using the address lines from the bottom two slices (0 and 1) for the write address. Although you can technically put the bottom two slice LUTs in dual port mode in the fpga_editor, the read and write addresses will always be the same. This is different from the Virtex where the two LUTs in a slice were combined to make a dual port RAM. In Virtex4, every LUT is dual ported, but only the top two have different read/write addresses.
